place.name: CARLBY
place.gazetteerText: CARLBY, a parish in Bourn district, Lincoln; on the river Glen and the Great Northern railway, near Essendine r. station, and 5 miles NNE of Stamford. Post Town, Stamford. Acres, 1,020. Real property, £1,555. Pop., 183. Houses, 40. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £195.* Patrons, the Marquis of Exeter and Sir E. Smith, Bart. The church is good. Charities, £7. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
